title: Disclosure and Pa Salieu Share New Song “King Steps”: Listen
description: A UK garage–influenced collaboration between the electronic duo and British Gambian rapper
author: Walden Green
excerpt: A UK garage–influenced collaboration between the electronic duo and British Gambian rapper
text: A UK garage–influenced collaboration between the electronic duo and British Gambian rapperDisclosure have shared a new song: “King Steps” is Guy and Howard Lawrence’s UK garage–inflected collaboration with British Gambian rapper Pa Salieu. “I know that garage music isn’t a genre people might expect me to jump on,” Salieu said in a press release, “but that’s what being an alien is about, moving from planet to planet, sound to sound.” Listen to “King Steps” below.Disclosure’s last album, Alchemy, came out in 2023. They’re nominated for Best Dance/Electronic Recording at the 2025 Grammy Awards for “She’s Gone, Dance On.”Earlier this month, Pa Salieu dropped his mixtape Afrikan Alien. It’s first project since 2020’s Send Them to Coventry.Hot LinksA daily roundup of the most important stories in music, and a listening guide every Friday
html:
A UK garage–influenced collaboration between the electronic duo and British Gambian rapper

Disclosure have shared a new song: “King Steps” is Guy and Howard Lawrence’s UK garage–inflected collaboration with British Gambian rapper Pa Salieu. “I know that garage music isn’t a genre people might expect me to jump on,” Salieu said in a press release, “but that’s what being an alien is about, moving from planet to planet, sound to sound.” Listen to “King Steps” below.

Disclosure’s last album, Alchemy, came out in 2023. They’re nominated for Best Dance/Electronic Recording at the 2025 Grammy Awards for “She’s Gone, Dance On.”

Earlier this month, Pa Salieu dropped his mixtape Afrikan Alien. It’s first project since 2020’s Send Them to Coventry.
